qas.question: In what year was Upper Alsace sold to the Archduke Sigismund?
Why did Frederick III use a tax and a marriage in Upper Alsace?

answers.text: to gain back full control of Upper Alsace

qas.question: When did Mulhouse join the Swiss Confederation?
What did Charles the Bold sell to Archduke Sigismund?
When did Frederick III become the Holy Emperor?
What is the name of one of the free towns?
What did the town of Mulhouse join in 1798?
When did Belfort join the Swiss Confederation?

context: In <a0_0><b4_0>1469<b4_0/><a0_0/>, following the Treaty of St. Omer, <b3_0>Upper Alsace<b3_0/> was sold by Archduke Sigismund of Austria to Charles the Bold, Duke of Burgundy. Although Charles was the nominal landlord, taxes were paid to Frederick III, Holy Roman Emperor. The latter was able to use this tax and a dynastic marriage to his advantage <a1_0>to gain back full control of Upper Alsace<a1_0/> (apart from the free towns, but including <b5_0>Belfort<b5_0/>) in 1477 when it became part of the demesne of the Habsburg family, who were also rulers of the empire. The town of Mulhouse joined <b6_0>the Swiss Confederation<b6_0/> in <a2_0><b7_0>1515<b7_0/><a2_0/>, where it was to remain until 1798.
